Job Description:
** Job Summary
To safeguard and defend the Company’s Business interests by minimizing/eliminating Legal exposure and conduct Business operations in a legally compliant manner.

** Responsibilities:
- Develop a yearly legal calendar and build the direction and strategy for legal and compliant work for YHS (Cambodia) Food & Beverage Pte Ltd. with alignment from YHS Group.
- Assist business in negotiation, structuring and documentation of various contracts with Distributors, Key accounts, Service providers, Suppliers, etc. within corporate guidelines; constantly monitor performance of various contracts
- Manage, draft and review legal documents and attend to litigation matters of the YHS (Cambodia) Food & Beverage Pte Ltd.
- Review and draft contract, amendment, addendum to be suitable for company business by working with legal agency.
- Lead the process to get legal licenses and renewal from related ministries or government institutions (MOC, MIH, MOE, HOH, CDC, etc.) to Operate.
- Prepare and submit compliance reports to related ministries or government institutions.
- Provide practical legal advice on a wide range of issues.
Monitor and review the quality and cost of services provided by third party counsel for area of practice .and take steps to optimize these costs.
- Ensure statutory requirements YHS Cambodia establishments are met.
- Advise on legal principles, provisions, guidelines and best practices. Provide legal and secretariat support to YHS Cambodia exercise whenever required.
- Protect and monitor the Intellectual Property Rights of the company. Manage and maintain statutory registers and corporate documents.
- Lead Due Diligence for third parties.
- Translate contract/documents from KH-En verse.
- Investigate the Code of Conduct case with relevant function and recommend the disciplinary action
- Be Company representative to work with Court for any legal dispute.
- Any other duties assigned.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor’s Degree in Law or its equivalent and qualified to act as Company Regulatory Affairs
- Experience in registration process, specific local regulatory requirements, and licenses with ministries or government institutions such as MOC, MIH, MOE, HOH, CDC, etc. is an advantage
- Must have a proven ability to communicate effectively in English in both written and verbal format
- Proven background in corporate law (experience with contract law and drafting, intellectual property law, and corporate governance)
- Minimum 7 of years’ relevant experience
- Excellent writing and communication skills
- Good interpersonal skills
- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

** Competencies Required:
- Regulatory Environment
- Awareness of political, legal, economic, consumer, marketing and socio-cultural issues affecting and defining the regulatory environment
- Able to interact professionally with external stakeholders, ministries or government institutions
- Knowledge of the company’s products and their major indications in local markets

** If you are interested, please send your CV to hrkh@yeos.com or YHS (Cambodia) Food & Beverage Pte Ltd, Phnom Penh Special Economic Zone, National Road #4, 
Phum Tachet, Sangkat Beung Thom, Khan Kambol, Phnom Penh.

Job Description:
- Initiating and ensuring the Next Gen 6 Months Development program’s initiatives are well organized, executed and well tracked.
- Monitoring assessment to ensure discipline sessions for all batches of Next Gen by working closely with training department.
- Managing Next Gen performance and validation including monthly budget to ensure effective spending.

- Initiating continuous process improvements to grow and improve the program year over year.

- Assisting Head of Training on other tasks relating to program development

Job Description:

•Good listening, negotiation and interpersonal skills
Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.

** Benefits	
Generous Wages

•	Hardworking and possess positive attitude

Job Description: មុខងារចម្បងនៃអ្នកបើកបរ គឺត្រូវបើកបរប្រកបដោយសុវត្ថិភាព ប្រុងប្រយ័ត្ន ផាសុខភាព ស្របតាមជំនាញវិជ្ជាជីវៈច្បាស់លាស់ ជាពិសេសគោរពច្បាប់ចរាចរណ៍។១. គោរពពេលវេលា ម៉ោងធ្វើការ២. ម៉ត់ចត់ក្នុងការងារ និងភាពប្រុងប្រយ័ត្នបំផុត៣. ត្រូវចេះរបៀបគារវកិច្ច ទទួលគោរពជាមួយថ្នាក់ដឹកនាំ និងភ្ញៀវ៤. ត្រូវថែរក្សាទាំងក្នុង និងក្រៅយានយន្តឱ្យបានស្អាត និងមានអនាម័យជានិច្ច៥. អាចធ្វើការថែមម៉ោងបាន
Job Requirement: ** Requirements/តម្រូវការការងារៈ• កាយសម្បទាមាំមួន សុខភាពល្អ ស្មារតីល្អ (កម្ពស់ចាប់ពី ១៧០ ស.ម)• មានបទពិសោធន៍យ៉ាងតិច ១ ឆ្នាំឡើងទៅ (ប្រភេទឡាន Mercedes ឬ ឡានស៊េរីទំនើប)• ចេះភាសាអង់គ្លេស (អាចនិយាយ និងស្ដាប់បានគួរសម)• ត្រូវស្គាល់ភូមិសាស្រ្តរាជធានីភ្នំពេញ និងបណ្តាខេត្តនានា ហើយអាចបើកបរដល់ពាក់កណ្តាលយប់(ម្តងម្កាល)• មានប័ណ្ណបើកបរស្របច្បាប់ ដែលចេញពីក្រសួងសាធារណៈការ និងដឹកជញ្ជូន• មានចំណេះដឹងចំពោះច្បាប់ចរាចរ និងស្លាកសញ្ញាចរាចរណ៍• ម៉ោងធ្វើការអាស្រ័យទៅតាម ថ្នាក់ដឹកនាំក្រុមហ៊ុន និង ចេះបត់បែនទៅតាមកាលៈទេសៈជាក់ស្តែង • មានចិត្តអត់ធ្មត់ ថែរក្សាទ្រពសម្បត្តិ នឹងស្រឡាញ់ការងារដែលថ្នាក់ដឹកនាំក្រុមហ៊ុន ប្រគល់ជូន**  Benefits/អត្ថប្រយោជន៍ៈ• ប្រាក់ខែចាប់ពី 200$-300$ (អាស្រ័យលើបទពិសោធន៍)• ប្រាក់រង្វាន់៧០% នៃប្រាក់ខែគោល សំរាប់អ្នកបើកបរណាដែរ មិនសុំច្បាប់ឈប់លើសពីកន្លះថ្ងៃក្នុងរយៈពេល៤ខែជាប់គ្នា                        • ឯកសណ្ឋានសំរាប់អ្នកបើកបរ (ខោចំនួន២ និង អាវសរចំនួន៣) ក្នុងមួយឆ្នាំ • ប្រាក់ថែមម៉ោង ផ្តល់ឱ្យ ១០០ ដុល្លារ នៅពេលណាម្ចាស់ក្រុមហ៊ុននៅប្រទេសកម្ពុជា• អាហារថ្ងៃត្រង់(ពេលណាមកការិយាល័យ) និង អាហារសាមគ្គីរៀងរាល់ខែ

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   012 797 939 hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh #11A, St. 402 Sangkat Tomnup teuk, Khan ChomkaMorn. phnom penh 012 797 939

Job Description:
- Maintain and record In-and-Out documents, and process In & Out documents to the relevant departments.
- In charge of organizing events either inside or outside the organization/school. Make sure proper checklist of items used in each event are recorded and return back to stock when finished the event.
- Ensure the student ID cards are issued on time and record and report of ID card issuance including broken ID card for Head Administrative Officer (HAO). Frequently check with warehouse about ID card and ensure it must not run out of stock.
- Make sure new term preparation checklist is done at least one week for the term starts. Drinking water, coffee, tea and other materials must be checked and report to HAO.
- Scan and copy necessary documents and process letter to parents
- Process the new student placement test, invigilate, mark the test and contact the interviewer to conduct the interview.
- Record and process meeting minutes and other documents for all departments when required.
- Inputting students’ results into database system and committed to human-error-free work.
- Ensuring the memo, poster, and announcement are posted on the bulletin board regularly.
- Stamping on documents, letter to parents, certificates and other official documents.
- Printing monthly attendance sheet for Aii at the end of the month.
- Maintaining student’s file and properly keep all documents including application forms, receipts and other necessary documents are kept safely, yet easily accessible when needed.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor Degree in Management, Education or other related fields.
- Administrative and Organizational Skills
- Experienced in dealing with administrative affairs in school or education field
- Be able to use office applications including Word, Excel, Power Point, and E-mail.
- Be able to communicate with team and can complete work with tight timelines and multiple deadlines.

Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted within 7 working days.
Please submit your cover letter, CV and 4 x 6 current photo to email HR department of MJQeducation as below.
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Job Description:
•Ensure proper supporting documents are in place before preparing the accounting voucher
•Ensure expense and revenue are properly recognized with the correct account and period
•Prepare the accounting transaction for line manager to review and approve
•Verify, allocate, post and reconcile accounting transactions
•Prepare payable aging report and ensure the payment to the supplier are on time
•Perform cash count and surprise cash count
•Prepare monthly bank reconciliation
•Monitor bank balance to ensure sufficient fund for operation
•Control fixed assets and non-fixed assets listing 
•Prepare depreciation and amortization schedule
•Prepare tax working and remit payment to the general department of taxation (VAT, WHT, Property Tax Salary Tax, Prepaid Profit Tax)
•Booking accrued for all the incomes and expenses during the month to comply with accrued basis principle
•Maintain accounting controls and ensures all accounting transactions are sufficiently supported
•Review and reconcile accounts assigned by the line manager
•Prepare month-end and year-end closing
•Assist line manager to prepare financial statements and other reports required by management
•Ensure all the works are properly implemented according to company’ policy and procedure
•Other tasks assign by the line manager
Job Requirement:
-Bachelor Degree in Banking and Finance, Accounting or Business
-Minimum of 4 years of progressively responsible experience of a large corporation especially in the Education industry
-Being able to use various accounting software such as Sun System, QuickBooks, Peachtree, etc.
-Good command of spoken and written English
-Good knowledge in accounting and taxation in Cambodia
-Being able to work under pressure and tough deadline
-Flexibility and willingness to learn and cope with the pressure
-Honesty, excellent interpersonal skills
-Strong commitment to duties and having an internal focus of control

Job Description:
• Work with GM, OM or Head of Department to design or 
  renovate spaces to meet their standards.
• Enhance the function, safety, and aesthetics of interior 
  spaces.
• Select samples including flooring, carpet, and paint to be 
  approved by Managers.
• Choose color palettes.
• Plan architectural detail such as crown molding.
• Read and interpret blueprints.
• Source for suppliers to purchase all materials for the 
  space.
• Work with vendors on the selection of pieces.
• Negotiate prices.
• Plan and estimate budgets for projects.
• Submit drawings for approval.
• Draw up floor plans and sketches;
• Supervise decorating of each store.
• Hang drapes and artwork.
• Arrange furniture.
• Coordinate work schedules.
• Follow up with suppliers to ensure design specifications 
  have been met.
• Always do the site inspection to make sure the 
  construction of each store meet the company’s standard.
• Other tasks as assigned by Manager.

company_name: ក្រុមហ៊ុន ម៉េងលី ជេ. គួច អេឌ្យូខេសិន (Mengly J. Quach Education)
Job Description:
-Preparation of individual audit planning – data collection, define key risk concerns, compile activities chart, etc. and reviewing the work plan of IA
-Taking lead of the individual internal audit team in each audit as well as full support to the operational internal audit team
-Supervision and monitoring of works performed by the team members
-Review of works performed by the team
-Review of reporting output prepared by team members
-Preparation of the consolidated internal audit reports
Maximizing effectiveness of the audit results through participation in the management meeting - debriefing
-Follow up on audit findings and its status of implementations with the audit targets
-Actively involved in controlling the departments under own responsibilities with respect to risks management, cost control management, business and controls risks – any particular worrying issues pertaining to these should be brought to the attention of the IAD/Operational IAS, then meeting with MJQE’s senior management for solutions
-Provide training to the team members when deem necessary, provide effective coaching to ensure effective knowledge exchange and internal audit quality in its process and output
-Ensure that all audit activities are monitored and its status be tracked against individual audit plan – audit commencement date, completion date of the audit field works, meeting notes etc.
-Ensure that all working practices at all stages are in line with the approved Internal Audit Policies in term of quality control procedures, sampling procedures, audit testing procedures etc.
-Assist to design IA policy, procedure and guideline for IA team to implement effectively
-Actively involved in discussion of audit findings and its status, provide feedback on effectiveness of post- audit corrections process and give recommendation for changes
-Focus on supported units (HRD, Administrative Department, Operations Division …) and Business Units (American Intercon School, Aii Language Center, Alex Food Court, Café Chateau, …)
-Other tasks assigned by the IAD/Operational IAS.
Job Requirement:
-University degree in banking/finance, accounting, business or economics
-At least two years of experience in internal audit in the microfinance/banking/audit firm/other sector
-Good understanding of Internal Control
-Strong computer skills (i.e. Microsoft Office)
-Ability to write timely, clear and concise reports on the findings
-Good written and spoken English, as well as communication and interpersonal skills
-High motivation and ability to work without supervision.

Job Description:
Position: Delivery Man (Car Driver) ($180-$250)
•	Salary: Gross $180-$250/month  (depends on experience)
•	Report to: Manager
•	Team size: Around 1 ppl
•	Vacancy: 1 person
•	Reason for hiring: New staff
Job Requirement:
•	ជំនាញ សមត្ថភាពនិង បទពិសោធន៍:
•	បញ្ជប់សញ្ញាប័ត្រថ្នាក់ទុតិយភូមិ។
•	មានបទពិសោធន៍យ៉ាងតិចមួយឆ្នាំទាក់ទងនឹងការដឹកជញ្ជូន។
•	មានជំនាញទំនាក់ទនងល្អជាមួយអតិថិជន។
•	ត្រូវមានភាពស្មោះត្រង់ក្នុងការងារ និងការអធ្យាស្រ័យល្អ។
•	សមត្ថភាព ក្នុងការយល់ពីសេចក្តីណែនាំ ទាំងពាក្យសំដី និងការសរសេរ។
•	ចំណេះដឹងនៃ ការចែកចាយទំនិញទៅកាន់អតិថិជន និងនីតិវិធីក្នុងការបំពេញការងារ។
•	អាចបើកបរម៉ូតូ និង ត្រីចក្រយានយន្តបាន ។
•	ភារកិច្ចការងារ និងការទទួលខុសត្រូវ :
•	ដឹកជញ្ជូនទំនិញទាន់ពេលវេលា និងគ្រប់ចំនួនទៅកាន់អតិថិជន។
•	ត្រូវឲ្យអតិថិជនចុះហត្ថលេខា ប្រគល់ទំនិញឲ្យបានច្បាស់លាស់ លើមុខទំនិញដែលអតិថិជនបានបញ្ជាទិញ។
•	លើកដាក់ឥវ៉ាន់ចេញពីស្តុក ឬចូលស្តុក ។
•	រៀបចំឥវ៉ាន់ទៅតាមលំដាប់លំដោយ និងតាមប្រភេទទំនិញ។
•	ទុកដាក់ឥវ៉ាន់ទៅតាមកន្លែងសមរម្យ សមស្របតាមលក្ខខណ្ឌដែលរោងចក្រកំណត់។ ឧទាហរណ៍ៈ ម៉ាស៊ីនព្រីន ត្រូវដាក់នៅកន្លែងដែលមិនក្តៅពេក ឬត្រជាក់ពេក។
•	បំពេញការងារឃ្លាំងដ៏ទៃទៀត និង ការងារមួយចំនួនទៀតតាមការចាត់តាំងពីអ្នកគ្រប់គ្រង ។

job title: ផ្នែកពិនិត្ យ(QC)  ចំនួន 1នាក់ (ស្រី-ប្រុស)
position: ផ្នែកពិនិត្ យ(QC)  ចំនួន 1នាក់ (ស្រី-ប្រុស)
Company Profile:
（浙江泰普森休闲用品有限公司）浙江泰普森休闲用品股份有限公司是浙江泰普森（控股）集团旗下支柱产业，创始于1991年，是集专业设计、开发、生产、经营、出口为一体的大型外向型企业。产品畅销欧美及亚洲等60多个国家和地区，出口额位列同行业前茅，是中国最具规模的户外休闲用品生产基地。

浙江泰普森休闲用品股份有限公司多年来始终坚持“专注于户外休闲用品领域以建立核心优势”，秉持“员工满意、客户满意和社会满意”的宗旨，使得泰普森事业迅速发展壮大。如今，泰普森在德清已建成占地面积30万平方米的泰普森休闲产业园，员工人数逾5000人。公司先后荣获“年度利税超亿元企业”、“浙江出口名牌”、“浙江省工业行业龙头骨干企业”、“浙江省企业技术中心”等一系列荣誉，为社会经济发展作出了巨大贡献。

20年来，泰普森取得的每一个成果，离不开国家的支持和社会各界的关心与厚爱，这种良好的外部环境使泰普森常怀感恩之心，激发了我们回馈社会的积极性和自觉性。

2008年5月22日，在那段众志成城抗震救灾的日子里，中共中央总书记、国家主席、中央军委主席胡锦涛同志亲临泰普森考察救灾帐篷生产情况。在社会各界的大力支持和全体员工的共同努力下，泰普森提前两天完成8.5万顶救灾帐篷的生产任务，圆满完成总书记的嘱托，为国家分忧。
Contact Info: Contact Information HR & Admin   015 558 099 / 017 559 458 / 097 833 5447 shubao.long@topsunleisure.com Vattanak park II, National Road 3, Sangkat Krang Pong Ro  Khan Dongkor, Phnom Penh City, Cambodia 015 558 099 / 017 559 458 / 097 833 5447

2008年5月22日，在那段众志成城抗震救灾的日子里，中共中央总书记、国家主席、中央军委主席胡锦涛同志亲临泰普森考察救灾帐篷生产情况。在社会各界的大力支持和全体员工的共同努力下，泰普森提前两天完成8.5万顶救灾帐篷的生产任务，圆满完成总书记的嘱托，为国家分忧。

（浙江泰普森休闲用品有限公司）浙江泰普森休闲用品股份有限公司是浙江泰普森（控股）集团旗下支柱产业，创始于1991年，是集专业设计、开发、生产、经营、出口为一体的大型外向型企业。产品畅销欧美及亚洲等60多个国家和地区，出口额位列同行业前茅，是中国最具规模的户外休闲用品生产基地。

浙江泰普森休闲用品股份有限公司多年来始终坚持“专注于户外休闲用品领域以建立核心优势”，秉持“员工满意、客户满意和社会满意”的宗旨，使得泰普森事业迅速发展壮大。如今，泰普森在德清已建成占地面积30万平方米的泰普森休闲产业园，员工人数逾5000人。公司先后荣获“年度利税超亿元企业”、“浙江出口名牌”、“浙江省工业行业龙头骨干企业”、“浙江省企业技术中心”等一系列荣誉，为社会经济发展作出了巨大贡献。

20年来，泰普森取得的每一个成果，离不开国家的支持和社会各界的关心与厚爱，这种良好的外部环境使泰普森常怀感恩之心，激发了我们回馈社会的积极性和自觉性。

company_name: Phnom Penh Land Development Co., Ltd
Company Profile:
Phnom Penh Land Development was established in 2016 but its long history was stemmed from some real estate business since 2012. The Company has engaged with big projects of apartments and condominiums for most of the international clients. We are now the developer of the smart city ready for stock exchange market of billion-dollar listing in New York. Grown well from the small to the big sizes among other local and international project developer in Cambodia, we are handling construction projects, including steel handicrafts, shops, houses, apartment, condominiums, villas, schools and many others. Our employees are now more than hundreds. Our vision is to create a safe environment for Cambodians to work, live and play with a mission to establish deep and meaningful collaborations for the betterment of real estate in Cambodia.

Job Description:
1. Providing administrative and clerical support to the members of the Quality Assurance Team.
2. Developing and maintaining databases for external verification, lesson observation, internal audit, SQA offers, and dealing with enquiries.
3. Developing and maintaining databases for tracking staff records and Quality Assurance Team publications.
4. Inputting and sorting data using appropriate statistical package.
5. Making arrangements for, and maintaining records of, External Audit and Moderator visits.
6. Making arrangements for, and maintaining records of, lesson observation activities.
7. Assisting in the maintenance of records relating to internal quality audits.
8. Assisting in the maintenance of an original set of College policies and procedures, and updating them for inclusion on the College Intranet as required.
9. Arranging the distribution of information from SQA, College policies and procedures and other relevant materials.

10. Word processing reports, minutes, letters, memos as required.
11. Dealing with staff enquiries relating to the Team’s work.
Job Requirement:
1. Make full use of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
2. Friendliness toward Japanese people and firms.
3. Tenacity and enthusiasm to perform the wide variety of tasks necessary at the time of business start-up.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:
• Fully in charge of a Electro/Mechanical project
• Ensure successful achievement of project mission statement and goals and be responsible for all day-to-day activities.
• Follow up with various departments within the company in all projcect related matters of the operation of the Project.
• To ensure a successful completion of the project within the budget and on time.
• Responsible for planning and scheduling of all major activites of the project to achieve timely completion of the project.
• Fully responsible for all contractual issues related to the day-to-day running of the project.
• Responsible for managing a staff/labor in the project.
• To be overall responsible for overseeing a effective execution of all project.
• To determine all project requirements (Technical and General).
• To ensure the timely submittal of all project submittals and obtaining approvals.(Samples, Shop Drawings, Design Details, Work Procedure, Method Statements, Schedules, Programs etc.)
• To arrange timely obtaining of all clearances, approvals, permissions, etc as may require from time to time from any of the statutory authorities during the execution of the project.
• To schedule and plan all project activities in line with Master program in co-ordination with the planning engineer.
• To receive all project related instructions from the client, engineer, main contractor, etc and transmit, communicate and arrange effective action.
• To attend all project related meeting with Client/engineer/main contractor and reporting back to the Manager on the proceedings as well as to attend all project related meetings.
• Assignment of all project related activities to all resources.
• To evaluate the requirement of all the project resources (materials, machinery, manpower) as per schedule and arrange for the availability of the same.
• Planning the scheduling of resources (material, manpower etc.) Resources mobilization.
Job Requirement:
Job Requirements:
•	Minimum of 5 years experiences 
•	Have a logical, analytical and creative approach to solve problem
•	Have good presentation skills.
•	Have good oral and written in Khmer and English, Chinese (Priority).
•	Have good negotiation skills, Communication skills, interpersonal skills; and problem solving skills.
•	Be friendly, flexible, honest, hard-working, and be able to work under pressure.
•	Have proficiency with word processing software as well as Technical drawing skills

Job Description:
Control quality of products from suppliers, production process, production activities, packaging, and delivery process.
Job Duty:
 -Control quality of inputs from suppliers
 -Control production process from quality points of view and promptly analyze the root causes then report to quality information center
 -Define controlled and verification quality items of finished goods
 -Inspect and test the quality of products after defined items
 -Control quality of packaging and delivery status
 -Assure product qualities with customers
 -Confirm customers work if there is any impacts to our products
 -Prepare quality documents to get approval from customers
 -Respond to customers' requests, including customer's audit
 -Hold quality meeting to get delivery approval
 -Analysis quality of part/product about in-line defect, customer/market 
 -Claim until take countermeasure and yokoten to stabilize.
Job Requirement:
-Age: 20 ~ 30 
-Sex: Male or Female
-Education: High diploma in Technical field or related field  
-GPA: 2.75up
-TOEIC: Score 500 up (preferable)
-Primary mathematics ability
-Basic PC skill (Excel, word, Power Point)
-English communication
-Open mind & team work mind
-Friendliness toward all associates
-Good problem analysis skill (QC tools is must, statistic method is wanted)
-Understand basic measurement method (Vernier and micro-meter is must. Precise measurement; e.g. Coordinate and shape measuring are wanted)

Job Description:
Location	: Phnom Penh and Battambang
Salary	:	$398 and other benefits

Summary of the Position:
The Finance Assistant will assist the Finance Officers in the day-to-day running and management of the finance department; completing delegated administrative tasks and ensuring the accuracy and maintenance of supporting documentation and accounting systems. 
Specific Areas of Responsibility:
• Ensure the accuracy and completeness of all finance records and transactions. 
• Maintain financial documents systematically including vouchers, cashbooks, reports, and other related documents in a secure place.
• Assist in preparing monthly financial reports and support documents
• Maintain the cash balance in the regional office safe and reconcile cash accounts
• Prepare the statement of the daily cash count of the cash book
• Prepare the bank reconciliation of all MAG bank accounts in the region. 
• Perform accounting duties in the absence of the Finance Officer
• Assist in processing bank transfers and purchase checks as needed
• Review all requests for payments for completeness, accuracy, and adherence to policy before submission to finance officer’ Liaise with the logistics department to advise on coding and accuracy. 
• Check for completeness of delivery and accuracy of bills before releasing payments.
• Any other administrative duties as requested by the Finance Officer
I. Responsibilities of all staff:	
As part of their roles, all MAG staff are required to:

• Uphold and implement MAG standard policies including, but not limited to the Policy on Personal Conduct, Protection of Children and Vulnerable Adults, Dignity at Work, Financial Crime Policy, Gifts and Hospitality Policy and Equal Opportunities Policy
• Understand and uphold the standards outlined in MAG’s Safeguarding Framework, acting with due care and attention to safeguard the wellbeing of anyone that comes into contact with MAG’s work and reporting concerns if they do arise.  
• Work within the framework of MAG’s core values, promoting its ethos and mission statement.
• Work towards achieving programme and/or department business plan objectives
• Ensure familiarity with and adhere to all MAG policies and procedures and keep informed of MAG activities 
• Undertake and apply learning from appropriate training and development programmes.
• Undertake the role in a manner appropriate to the cultural context and within the local legal framework
• On occasion, work outside regular working hours as circumstances dictate.
Job Requirement:
II. Qualifications and Core Competencies: 
Essential qualifications, experience and skills
• Bachelor Degree in Business Administration and Finance or other related field
• 1-year training and experience in book keeping
• 1-year experience in working with an NGO
• Experience and knowledge of financial systems, policies and procedures
• Experience in managing cash flow
• Ability wo work as a member of a team and communicate across departments
• Able to work with minimal supervision
• Commitment to the guiding principles of MAG
Desirable
• English speaking an advantage

How to apply: Interested applicants who meet the requirements should submit a Cover Letter and CV with three referees (certificates should not be included with the application and please subject the email with the position you are applying for, Ex: Ms/ Mr. Xxx Xxx is applying for Finance Assistant) -PNP; for Phnom and Ms/ Mr. Xxx Xxx is applying for Finance Assistant – BTB for Battambang to:

1. MAG Head Office: #9AB, St 446, Sangkat Tuol Tompoung, Khan Chamkar Morn, Phnom Penh, Tel: 023 215 115
2. MAG Battambang: #99, Group10 , Rumchek 4 Village, Rattanak Commune, Battambang, Tel: 053 952 546
3. MAG Ratanakiri: #136, St. 78, 7Makara Village, Sangkat Labansiek, Krong Banlung, Ratanakiri, Tel: 012 978 456
E-mail: Jobs.Cambodia@maginternational.org
Application Deadline: 19th October 2020
All applications will be retained in MAG and only short-listed applicants will be contacted.
Please input the names and phone numbers of two referees in your CV, preferably who know you in a professional context.
As part of MAG’s commitment to safeguarding, this post is subject to background checks before an offer of employment is confirmed.

Job Description:
Main responsibility as the Assistant Manager for the Finance and Accounting Department and to report directly to the Head of Finance and Accounting. Responsibilities include the following:
•	To review the work performed by the Accountants on daily basis including the monthly closing items, e.g. bank reconciliations, accounts payable ledger, etc
•	Preparation and review of the monthly management and financial statements including the tax returns
•	To ensure that the company’s internal control systems are effective and to recommend improvements on the systems when necessary
•	Preparation of the annual budget and the monthly operating budgets including the cash flows statement 
•	To coordinate and liaise with external auditors, internal auditors, and tax auditors during any of such audits
•	Review the work done by the general accountant including but not limited
•	Accounting data entries by the Accountant
•	Fixed asset register
•	Cash count sheets
•	Invoices and statement of accounts
•	Monthly tax declaration	
•	Bank reconciliations
•	Advances and clearance
•	Review of monthly financial statements including, statement of financial position, statement of comprehensive income, cash flow statement (direct method) and statement of changes in equity
•	Review monthly and annual tax returns.
•	Preparation of annual financial statements.
•	Preparation of management accounts and produces basic ratio calculation such as Gross profit margin, gearing ratio and current ratio, receivable collection days and payable collection days, etc., and perform analysis and comments on these ratios
•	Monitoring the payable and receivables of the Company, approve payable and receivable transactions, ensure all debts are collected and all creditors are paid according to the agreed terms
•	Monitoring the related party transactions and prepare monthly related party transactions reconciliation report
•	To ensure all assets and liabilities are identified and properly recorded in financial statements
•	To ensure accounting processes and accounting standards as set out in the Company’s financial manual are properly complied with
•	Preparation of monthly operational budgets, and other budgets specifically required by the Head of Finance, including cash flows statements
•	Assist the Head of Finance in the preparation of cash flow forecasts and capital projects investment analysis
•	To coordinate and liaise with external auditors, internal auditors, and tax auditors during any of such audits
•	To review and improve on company accounting policy, if necessary
•	To ensure the accuracy and validity of the financial statements
•	To collaborate with the tax advisor regarding the company’s tax planning and tax filing preparation
•	To ensure that all the accounting processes and policies are properly carried out
•	To carry out any other tasks that may be assigned by the Head of Finance & Accountant
Job Requirement:
•	A recognized Bachelor Degree Majoring in Finance and Accounting, or its equivalent
•	Proficiency in Mandarin and Khmer
•	Have a clear understanding of Cambodian International Financial Reporting standards and of Cambodia tax law
•	Minimum 8 years’ experiences in a medium to large accounting, Or in a similar role of a large industrial or commercial company
•	Candidate who has completed FIA (Foundation in accounting) or at professional level (paper P1 to P7) of ACCA (Association of Chartered Certified Accountants) courses will only be considered
•	High ethical, moral, and professional standards; high confidentiality standards; good social behavior; neat appearance; must have an attention for details; common sense and good judgment; and a problem solver
Company Profile: Phnom Penh City Center (PPCC) is a 111.6-hectare development strategically located in the center of the city. This development was conceptualized to transform Phnom Penh’s city landscape into a modern, sustainable, commercial and leisure hub with world class facilities purpose-built for both local and overseas businesses and investors. Through the creation of new facilities and spaces, this development will create opportunities for the growth of commerce, culture, arts and sports in Phnom Penh City Center (PPCC). By 2025, the new PPCC district will be home to over 56,000 residents and more than 190,000 daily visitors. Job Description:
•	To review the work performed by the Accountants on daily basis including the monthly closing items, e.g. bank reconciliations, accounts payable ledger, etc
•	Preparation and review of the monthly management and financial statements including the tax returns
•	To ensure that the company’s internal control systems are effective and to recommend improvements on the systems when necessary
•	Preparation of the annual budget and the monthly operating budgets including the cash flows statement 
•	To coordinate and liaise with external auditors, internal auditors, and tax auditors during any of such audits
•	Review the work done by the general accountant including but not limited
•	Accounting data entries by the Accountant
•	Fixed asset register
•	Cash count sheets
•	Invoices and statement of accounts
•	Monthly tax declaration	
•	Bank reconciliations
•	Advances and clearance
•	Review of monthly financial statements including, statement of financial position, statement of comprehensive income, cash flow statement (direct method) and statement of changes in equity
•	Review monthly and annual tax returns.
•	Preparation of annual financial statements.
•	Preparation of management accounts and produces basic ratio calculation such as Gross profit margin, gearing ratio and current ratio, receivable collection days and payable collection days, etc., and perform analysis and comments on these ratios
•	Monitoring the payable and receivables of the Company, approve payable and receivable transactions, ensure all debts are collected and all creditors are paid according to the agreed terms
•	Monitoring the related party transactions and prepare monthly related party transactions reconciliation report
•	To ensure all assets and liabilities are identified and properly recorded in financial statements
•	To ensure accounting processes and accounting standards as set out in the Company’s financial manual are properly complied with
•	Preparation of monthly operational budgets, and other budgets specifically required by the Head of Finance, including cash flows statements
•	Assist the Head of Finance in the preparation of cash flow forecasts and capital projects investment analysis
•	To coordinate and liaise with external auditors, internal auditors, and tax auditors during any of such audits
•	To review and improve on company accounting policy, if necessary
•	To ensure the accuracy and validity of the financial statements
•	To collaborate with the tax advisor regarding the company’s tax planning and tax filing preparation
•	To ensure that all the accounting processes and policies are properly carried out
•	To carry out any other tasks that may be assigned by the Head of Finance & Accountant
Job Requirement:
•	A recognized Bachelor Degree Majoring in Finance and Accounting, or its equivalent
•	Proficiency in English and Khmer
•	Mandarin speaking is an added advantage
•	Have a clear understanding of Cambodian International Financial Reporting standards and of Cambodia tax law
•	Minimum 8 years’ experiences in a medium to large accounting, Or in a similar role of a large industrial or commercial company
•	Candidate who has completed FIA (Foundation in accounting) or at professional level (paper P1 to P7) of ACCA (Association of Chartered Certified Accountants) courses will only be considered
•	High ethical, moral, and professional standards; high confidentiality standards; good social behavior; neat appearance; must have an attention for details; common sense and good judgment; and a problem solver
Company Profile: Phnom Penh City Center (PPCC) is a 111.6-hectare development strategically located in the center of the city. This development was conceptualized to transform Phnom Penh’s city landscape into a modern, sustainable, commercial and leisure hub with world class facilities purpose-built for both local and overseas businesses and investors. Through the creation of new facilities and spaces, this development will create opportunities for the growth of commerce, culture, arts and sports in Phnom Penh City Center (PPCC). By 2025, the new PPCC district will be home to over 56,000 residents and more than 190,000 daily visitors. In line to expand our business, we are looking for dynamic and qualified candidates to join us to make this company grow further.If the above job requirements ideally match your profile, we would like to invite you to apply with your CV (cover letter is not required) by stating:1. Applying Position2. Salary Expectation3. Your Earliest Commencement Period

Job Description:
** Main Duties
- Analyzing information to recommend and plan the development and/or enhancement of existing/new systems.
- Researching, designing, implementing, and managing software programs.
- Directing software programming and documentation development.
- Maintaining and identifying areas for modification in existing programs and subsequently developing these modifications.
- Working closely with other developers, UX designers, business and systems analysts.
- Consulting with engineering staff to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements.
Job Requirement:
** General Requirements
- Honest, responsible, hardworking, initiative, self-improvement, and willing to learn
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
- Good problem solving and organizational skills
- Team-oriented, self-motivated, and positive attitude
- Ability to manage multiple priorities and commitments to deadline
- Proficiency in English, both verbal and written

** Specific Requirements:
- Bachelor & degree in Computer Science or Computer Software Engineering.
- Minimum 1 years of work experience in Software Development.
- Understand concepts of the software development life-cycle.
- Experience with software design and development.
- Experience working with Linux environment.
- Experience with programming languages: PHP, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
- Good command of C programming languages is a plus.
- Experience with RDMBS such as MySQL or Oracle
- Good at problem-solving, algorithm and data structure

We are willing to offer competitive compensation packages in line with the industry’s practices (the salary range for Software Developer is 500 USD to 1500 USD. Higher salary may be considered for candidates with high qualification). Successful candidates will be provided with on-the-job training and other relevant trainings.

Job Description:
** Scope of Work 
The Payment Accountant position is responsible for assist daily operation with Payment Supervisor.

- Inform supplier and release the payment upon approval for payment from authorized personnel.
- Ensure to have a sufficient daily petty cash fund to pay to supplier
- Ensure to release payment in cash or bank check to supplier and internal staff
- Close daily expenses and transfer all remaining petty cash to Payment Supervisor
- Stamp paid once the transaction is completed and filling all type of accounting documents (BV, CV, TF, RV, JV).
- Issue monthly invoice to customer (for other revenue)
- Perform follow up for to customer and ensure collections are always on time
- Collect money and issue official receipt to customer
- Support and act as income officer for cash collection as needed during the opening of new term (Aii & AIS)
- Ensure all the works are properly implemented according to company’ policy and procedure
- Other tasks assign by Payment Supervisor
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor Degree in Banking and Finance, Accounting or Business
- Min 1 years of progressively responsible experience in Accounting field 
- Being able to use various accounting software such as Sun System, Quickbook, Peachtree etc.
- Good command of spoken and written English.
- Flexibility and willing to learn and cope with pressure
- Honesty, excellent interpersonal skills
- Strong commitment to duties and having an internal focus of control

*** Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted within 7 working days
Please submit your cover letter, CV and 4 x 6 current photo to email HR department of MJQeducation as below.
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

Company Profile:
About Us

Grant Thornton Cambodia is an independent member within Grant Thornton International and a wholly foreign-owned company. Grant Thornton’s presence in Cambodia first started in 2004. A reorganisation in 2011 incorporated the expertise of Grant Thornton Malaysia to expand the service lines to meet the increasing demand for quality audit and advisory services of local business and international investors in Cambodia. 

Grant Thornton has offices in more than 140 counties and  56,000 staff.

To support our continued growth, we are looking for a high calibre talented professional to manage a Client portfolio and oversee the provision of high quality audit, accounting and tax compliance services.

Job Description:

Event & Workshop Coordinator with a "can-do" attitude to assist our organization in hosting events that enhance our organization's image, improve client loyalty, and enhance our brand-to-client experience.

- Brainstorming and implementing event plans and concepts.
- Handling budgeting and invoicing.
- Liaising and negotiating with vendors.

- Updating senior management.
- Managing branding and communication.
- Developing event feedback surveys.
- Obtaining permits.
- Handling post-event reports.
- Initial the new Marketing Collateral 
- Prepare and control Marketing Collateral Stock

- Project management experience.
- Good leadership skills.
- Highly Organized.
- Multi-tasker.
- Good time management.
- Expert interpersonal skills.

Job Description:
- Create first-class digital engagement experiences to engage and delight our customers. 
- Gathering and evaluating user requirements, in collaboration with product managers. 
- Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences 
- Designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets 
- Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, prototypes and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces 
- Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features. 
- Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs. 
- Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. 
- Ask smart questions
- take risks and champion new ideas 
- Understand Cambodia’s demographics and segmentation to build overall storyline and journey for features on Prudential’s App. 
- Create experiences that effectively engages industry audiences at each stage of the buying journey.
Job Requirement:
Experience/Skill: 
- Degree/Diploma in Design, Computer Science or relevant field 
- Three or more years of UX design experience.
- Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments 
- A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, usability and accessibility concerns 
- Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams 
- A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking. 
- Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications. 
- Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders 
- Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment 
- Self-directing and agile, with the ability to quickly pivot strategies, as needed 

Knowledge: 
- Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop 
- Knowledge of vector graphics editor and prototyping tool such as Figma, Marvel etc 
- Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Job Description:
Job Description
1 Scope of Working
Manages the overall direction, coordination and evaluation of Accounts. The main roles of the post are
preparing financial statement, monitoring a company’s finances, supervising financial report and budget
planner, reviewing financial report and seeking ways to reduce costs, analyzing market trends, and
advising subordinates on ideas as how to maximize profits. Recommendation to superior on taxation how
to minimize tax payment with legalization.
2 Duties and Responsibilities
- To prepare financial reports, such as income statements, balance sheets, and analyses of future
earnings or expenses.
- To prepare monthly and yearly budget and make comparison with fiscal year
- To organize budgets to meet its financial goals.
- To prepare and update Cash flow report.
- Carrying out business modeling and risk assessment.
- Review and verify approval of invoices and purchase order
- Ensure accuracy in daily invoices and meet time limits
- Study and standardize procedures to improve efficiency of subordinates, and expedite workflow
- Trains and evaluates employees to enhance their performance, development, and work product.
- Supervise subordinate operation day to day to ensure they met deadline with effective and
efficient output.
- Coordinate with tax and audit authorities
- Keep up date the changes in financial and tax related regulations and legislation
- Work with internal and external auditors during reviews and audits to ensure full cooperation
from accounting staff.
- Various office management functions.

Job Description:
Deadline:	31 st October 2020
Shortlist:	Only shortlisted candidate will be contacted.

Duties and Responsibilities:

- Provide and analyze plant performance tracking 
- Support overall Plant process inclusive of planning, approval process, funding release and performance tracking to assure streamline operation with optimum efficiencies. 
- Establish and ensure to have the completed and very accurate Plant planning (i.e. latest estimated, outlook, budget, 4 years financial planning) and ensure that all are align with company strategy and business plan.

- Support other assignment as assigned.

- Minimum 3 years’ experience in Financial or accounting background or other related field. Ability to use an ERP system (SAP) is preferred

- Team working ability, build relationship with internal and external stakeholder
- Good analytical and problem-solving skills

Job Description:
-	Data-driven marketer in charge of attracting site traffic, converting that traffic into new leads for the business, and nurturing those leads to close into customers.
-	Understand Cambodia’s demographics, segmentation and needs, to build overall strategy for Insurance and Value-Added Services on PULSE to attract customers from all segments to the Prudential’s App.
-	Understanding customer segments and create user experiences that effectively engages customers at each stage of buying journey and increases usage which generates daily activity.
-	Experiment with various content formats such as written, visual, video, audio etc through various mediums like KOI/KOLs, Key Speakers, bloggers etc to develop a well-balanced content strategy.
-	Create various type of content for communities.
-	Develop content calendar, delegate tasks and ensure deadlines are met
-	Execute distribution plan of created content
-	Receive customer feedback and generate ideas to increase customer engagement
-	Spearhead testing new content types and developing strategies
-	Discover areas of improvement/opportunities with team processes and implement solutions
-	Facilitate content marketing relationships with interdepartmental stakeholders
-	Based on any given keyword, conduct thorough research and competitive analysis on a topic. Understand how to produce high-quality and competitive content
Job Requirement:
-	Proven work experience as a Content marketing manager
-	Proficiency in MS Office and WordPress or other Content Management Software
-	Expertise in social media platforms
-	Project management skills and attention to detail
-	Excellent communication and writing skills in English and Khmer
-	Has experience in doing keyword research and using SEO tools
-	Exceptional upward and downward communication skills, and the ability to communicate with important stakeholders about complex content and SEO matters
-	A passion for and a strong understanding of the industry and our business mission.
-	Exceptional writing and editing skills, as well as the ability to adopt the style, tone, and voice of the brand
-	Demonstrated background in writing for SEO
-	Excellent organizational skills to work independently and manage projects with many moving parts.
-	Ability to manage tight deadlines from multiple people.
-	Basic graphic design knowledge preferred.
-	Experience using content management systems
-	Experience using SEO research tools, such as SEMrush and Ahrefs etc.
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

Job Description:
1- Account Receivable
- Reviewing daily debtors and follow up overdue customers to ensure that the settlement is made on due date.
- To update the debtor’s status and take action seriously on long outstanding customers.
- Ensuring that any return product from customers, credit is issued on time together with proper supporting documents and clear off in the system.
- Verify the collection with receipt from collector and prepare collection report on daily basis.
- Regularly bank-in the collection per policy guideline.
- Ensure that all collections are daily posted in to SAP to keep up to date status of debtors.

2- Filing and month end closing
- Ensure all invoices, receipts are filing properly and keep per local statutory requirement.
- Monitoring invoices submitted from logistic department to ensure that all invoices are signed receipt from customers. 
- Ensuring all data process are capture correctly in to the system and before or by deadline of closing.

3- Other support
- Back up CS role when is required.
- Conduct quarterly and yearly inventory physical count with warehouse staff and reconciliation deviation between physical stock and system.
- Support logistic for external auditor and tax auditor.
Job Requirement:
- Graduated in Accounting/Finance
- Strong communication skill and problem solving
- Hard working and high committed with tight deadline
- Preferable with experience in using SAP
- Must have 2-3 years’ experience in handling Account Receivable and At lest 1 years’ experience in handling Account Receivable. 
- CAT is a plus an advantage
- Good command of English

job title: Assistant Manager, Business Analysis & Quality Assurance
position: Assistant Manager, Business Analysis & Quality Assurance
Job Description:
Core Technical
•	Lead Business Analyst team in core and non-core system support, issue investigation, resolution or escalation to technical team.
•	Conduct requirement gathering, analysis, and solution exploration.
•	Work closely with technical/architecture lead in ensuring timely delivery according to plan and delivering high quality solution with proper documentation.
•	Follow company defined SDLC (Waterfall, Agile) for project/change implementation and produce necessary deliveries for compliance, audit and internal handover.
•	Provide IT work breakdown structure and progress update to project manager/lead on IT delivery.
•	Coordinate and assist business function in UAT and business verification.
•	Work with MI & BI team to ensure all MIS/business statistic reporting are designed and delivered correct according to business function’s need and requirement.
•	Observe international and company standards change management process for both core and non-core system e.g. change tracking, change documentation, agile delivery.
•	Data analysis and SQL query for report and data.
•	Perform internal QA and coordinate UAT and sign-off.
•	Coordinate internal and regional deployment.

Vendor Technical Management
•	Understand technical design and implementation of vendor's solution.
•	Managed and maintain vendor technical documentations provided to PCLA
•	Responsible as first line support for issue and technical issue escalation to vendor for support.
•	Bridge between business user and vendor's Business Analyst/Project Manager to translate business needs/challenge into functional logic.
•	Work with cross-functional stakeholders in various vendors engagement processes like Request for Proposal, Proposal technical evaluation, vendor recommendation base on technical standpoint, etc.
•	Ensure that vendor deliver the right product fitting to requirements and scope.

Management
•	Assist in planning and managing IT solution budget.
•	Assist in leading Business Analysis & Quality Assurance team
•	Assist in translating company into department strategy and action plans for team
Job Requirement:
Experience/Skill:
•	Bachelor’s Degree in information system management, Computer Science
•	and Business preferred.
•	4+ years with proven project management experience in Information Systems implementation or IT consultancy/Business Analysts.
•	Experience in insurance policy administration (e.g. LIFE/Asia) system support, usage, configuration and consultancy preferred.


Knowledge/Skill:
•	Ability to interact with business users in a professional manner.
•	In-depth understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC), Waterfall and Agile (DevOps or Scrum).
•	Being good at listening skills, teamwork and demonstrates intellectual curiosity.
•	Good knowledge in software documentation, standard, and best practices.
•	Ability to deliver technical jargons in layman terms.
•	Understanding of life insurance business is preferable
•	Understand in various OS Window Server, Linux, UNIX and VMware is preferable.

Job Description:
•	Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision making across the organization.
•	Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
•	Writes unit/integration tests, contributes to engineering wiki, and documents work.
•	Performs data analysis required to troubleshoot data related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues.
•	Works closely with a team of frontend and backend engineers, product managers, and analysts.
•	Defines company data assets (data models), spark, sparkSQL, and hiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
•	Designs data integrations and data quality framework.
•	Designs and evaluates open source and vendor tools for data lineage.
•	Works closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long term data platform architecture.
•	Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
•	Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
•	Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
•	Design and implement data modelling for business analytic used by Business Intelligence team and also for performance reporting.
•	Support and maintain data streaming and modelling integrity.
•	Design, produce, maintain company data flow diagram.
•	Design data model implementation framework and standard to ensure consistency across systems.
•	Ensure that all data design, development and implementation are compliant with group data policy.
•	Lead junior and mid-level team members to delivery project assignment in time and meeting quality requirement.
•	Provide technical coaching and training to junior and mid-level team members.
•	Provide technical review to team members to ensure quality.
Job Requirement:
Experience/Skill:
•	Bachelor or Higher Degree in Computer Science and engineering OR Management Information System
•	Experience working with multiple enterprise system database and various data structure type.
•	Experienced in working with databases such as Microsoft SQL Server, DB2, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure SQL PaaS DB
•	Experience working with cloud database, storage and data services: Azure Database, Azure Blob, Azure Data Factory.
•	Experience in working with corporate process and Regional policies and framework.
•	Experience working with NoSQL data and API to consume API and data visualization.
•	Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
•	Experience with stream-processing systems: SQL Server Integration Services, Azure Data Factory, Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
•	Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.

Bonus
•	Experience working with building or maintaining data lake.
•	Experience working external data feed such as from partner systems, social media, and google analytic.

Knowledge/Skill:
•	Data Query Language: MS SQL, N1QL (CouchDB)
•	Database: MS SQL, PosgreSQL, MongoDB, CouchDB
•	Excel + VBA
•	Data Visualization: PowerBI, Tableau
•	Data Integration/Streaming: SQL Server Integration Services, Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
•	Knowledge in modern technology such a mobile app, infographic, data visualization on mobile.
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

Job Description:
- Review internal control systems by updating audit programs and questionnaires; recommending new policies and procedures.
- Direct the identification and evaluation of the organization’s risk areas and oversees the development of the annual Audit Plan.
- Direct the overall performance of audit procedures, including identifying and defining issues, developing criteria, reviewing and analyzing evidence, and documenting client processes
- Monitor and follow up all the irregular transactions and check compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
- Check over Operations business at head office and branch level
- Review financial statements, NBC reports, and tax declaration monthly
- Direct the audit staff, interviews clients and/or stakeholders to confirm the concern and suspicious transactions, reviewing documents
- Draft audit result, summarize audit reports and recommendation to send to internal Audit Manager for reviewing
- Involve in the debriefing of audit result to management to make sure that they understand well about detail audit finding issues with immediate recommendations to follow up
action.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor degree in banking management or equivalent.
- At least 1 years’ experience in banking services development at least.
- Knowledge in banking business, banking risk or banking operation.
- Demonstrate high passion, and commitment.
- Pleasant personality & professional responsibility

Benefits:
1- Khmer New Year Bonus
2-Pchum Ben Bonus
3-Yearly Bonus
4-NSSF + GAP Insurance covered 24hours with 10K+ RMF’s Medical package
5- Uniform
6- Perdiem Package out of business area
7- Monthly phone top-up

Company Profile:
Royal Micro Finance PLC (RMF) was established as a public limited company holding license, number: M.F-56 from National Bank of Cambodia in July 2015 to provide financial services to indeed clients, and it was officially registered at Ministry of Commerce, number ៣០៣២ ពណ ចបព. Royal Microfinance​ PLC fully operates services to all targeted clients for micro and small financial need on both business and personal purposes.

Royal Microfinance PLC has a strong commitment to perform a standard and professional operation in both management and MIS. Moreover, wide varieties of competitively marketable products and processes have been prudently designed in responding to the rising demands of various micro finance services.

The fundamental core value of RMF is to provide clients with fair and transparent micro-finance services to obtain mutual benefit and growth.

Job Description:
- Find potential clients to get the loan products and services in their geographic areas or boundaries.
- Build a very good relationship with all levels of local authorities to get their supports on loan documents process.
- Analyze borrowers’ business plan and financial flows to get more and more reliable data and information related to their businesses income and family status.
- Assess and evaluate borrowers’ properties with the up to date market price and check the legal ownership.
- Educate the credit rule and policies strictly to borrowers before processing the loan documents.
- Set up the plan with OM for loan disbursement projection as monthly, quarterly and annually basis.
- Closely follow up the borrowers on their business change or any problems then report to direct supervisor for taking early action on time. Ensure the loan repayment with 100% & follow up.
- Work closely with marketing and product development officer to research competitor business strength
and weakness and new product development.
- Make a daily report to OM for consolidating all data to make a daily client information and loan document submit record to OM.
Job Requirement:
- 3rd Year / 4th Year or Fresh graduate or Bachelor degree in banking management or equivalent.
- Honesty, initiative, flexibility, high commitment and good inter-personal and communication skills.
- Good working knowledge of computer (Ms. Office & Internet).
- Ability to effectively communicate in English and Khmer.
- Good understanding of Cambodian micro finance rules and regulations, law on real estate and contract law.
- Minimum 2 years or 3 years relevant working experience with MFI or Bank.

Benefits:
1- Khmer New Year Bonus
2-Pchum Ben Bonus
3-Yearly Bonus and Monthly Incentive
4-NSSF + GPA Insurance covered 24hours with 10K+ RMF’s Medical package
5- Uniform
6- Perdiem Package out of business area
7- Monthly phone top-up

Job Description:
•	Lead technical business analysis and agile software engineer team by providing expertise requirement gathering & analysis, solution design & documentation, unit testing, data structure & design, and solution verification needed in delivery of digital technology/tool or platform systems regional for local transformation project/initiative.
•	Analyze current technology trend, and regional technology roadmap, and internal company’s technology current state and design for future convergence and sustainability.
•	Document and monitor requirements needed to institute proposed updates
•	Propose and establish framework for necessary contributions from various departments.
•	Account for possible project technical challenges on constraints including, risks, time, resources and scope.
•	Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions.
•	Local and regional solution roadmap design and architect convergence.
•	Build and establish company software framework and development standards to align with Regional direction.
•	Design and lead internal development team in implementation of local in-house mobile or web app system for business needs.
•	Local technical lead for all integration and technical implementation with Regional technology team.
•	Integration lead for various technical integration with regional platforms or third-party platform system such as eWallet partner, bank partner, lead generation partner etc.
•	Technical support and solution training and handover to application management and support team once system is live past pilot and transition into business-critical operational system.
Job Requirement:
Experience/Skill:
•	Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure.
•	Degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering preferred.
•	Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures.
•	Experience in software engineering and design architecture.
•	Positive outlook in meeting challenges and working to a high level.
•	Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes.
•	Professional experience working with and analyzing computer hardware and software.
•	Extensive knowledge and experience working with operating systems.
•	Digital technology technical forward thinking and ability to design for change.
•	Mobile App, Cloud solution, and modern web app design and development.

Bonus
•	Experience with DBMS technology (SQL, NoSQL, NewSQL), Big Data, data semantics, and data analysis.
•	Familiarity with any cloud services is desired, preferably Azure Cloud Services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, CaaS)
•	Innovative thinker who is positive, proactive and readily embraces change
•	Strong understanding of Business Intelligence concepts and best practices, with an understanding of its strategic importance to organizations


Knowledge/Skill:
•	Professional technical and business documentation.
•	In-depth understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC), Waterfall and Agile (DevOps or Scrum).
•	Being good at listening skills, teamwork and demonstrates intellectual curiosity.
•	Ability to work with a globally distributed cross functional team.
•	Good knowledge in software document

Company Profile: First Commercial Bank is the world’s top 200 Bank, with international credit rating A by the Standard and Poor's, and A1 by the Moody's. We have nearly 200 branches in Taiwan and 43 overseas branches/ sub-branches/ offices in 16 countries including USA, UK, Europe, Japan, Australia, Canada, Singapore, Great China, and ASEAN countries. The total employee numbers around the world are more than 8,000.First commercial Bank Phnom Penh Branch, established in 1998 in the city center, is one of the earliest foreign banks in Cambodia. In addition to the Phnom Penh Branch (Head Office), First Commercial Bank has 9 sub-branches, namely Chorm Chaov Sub-Branch, Olympic Sub-Branch, Chamkamorn Sub-Branch, Toul Kork Sub-Branch, Chraoy Chongvar sub-branch, Mean Chey sub-branch, Siem-Reap sub-branch, Phsar Derm Thkov sub-branch and Sen Sok sub-branch, which constitutes a solid operation network in Phnom Penh City.

Job Description:
- Monitor subordinate’s performance
- Develop and implement effective deployment plan of workforce including location mapping, resources allocation, key milestones, timeline, reporting structure, and monitoring mechanisms
- Prepare budget plan of the project and report to Client’s Management Team and Head of Outsourcing
- Analyze and Monitor Project Costing
- Schedule regular meeting with Client to discuss and solve issues of the project
- Prepare kick-off plan for new additional headcounts including recruitment plan, budgeting, costing, and workshop
- Work with Recruitment team to build candidates pool for Staff Outsourcing Service and ensure vacancies of each project are filled on time.
- Conduct regular field visit to fully understand in and out of the project
- Explore effective ways in managing the project and deliver more efficient results
- Develop and implement effective HR strategy for the project
- Integrates HR strategy to support the delivery of the project objectives
- Works with Subordinates, HR Executive, Clients and other relevant persons to ensure outsourced activities meet quality standards and expectations and adheres to applicable Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Environment
Health and Safety (EHS), Working Processes (WPs), Policies, Guidelines, and Regulations
- Ensures smooth and effective communication between Clients and ODI throughout the life of the project
- Resolve employee relations issues and address grievances
- Work closely with Clients and employees to improve working relationships, build staff morale, improve performance and increase retention
- Provide HR policy guidance to project team and ensure understanding and compliance
- Monitor and report on workforce movement and workforce planning
- Identify training needs for employees and ensure the right delivery of the training solutions for employees
- Build a sensible and proper career path for employees to progress and grow under Client’s Project
- Attend meetings and act as a representative of ODI
- Prepare necessary presentation for Clients on behalf of ODI
- Lead and manage changes to ensure smooth organizational changes and transitions which will better prepare the team to support the realization of client’s business goals
- Builds and maintain good relationships with various levels, including ODI Senior Leadership Team (SLT), line manager, clients and employees and other relevant persons to enable influencing and aligning everyone to the goals of the
ODI and client’s business.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor Degree in Business Management or related field
- Thorough knowledge of Cambodia labor laws
- Good understanding of all aspect of HR and able to apply best practices
- Experience and sound knowledge of Talent, Rewards, Business Partnering and Change Management
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills
- Able to engage and influence people across different levels
- Strong planning and organizational skills
- Able to think critically and solve complex problems
- Competent in using Ms. Office (Word, Excel and Power Point)
- Able to travel to any provinces

Core Competencies: Competencies are observable behaviors that encompass the knowledge, skills, and personal characteristics that distinguish levels of performance
in the work environment. Read each responsibility / task listed under job description and ask what competency required in order to performance those responsibilities /
tasks.
 Talent Management
 Cambodia Labor Laws
 Business Partnering
 Change Management
 Communication
 Interpersonal
 Engagement
 Negotiation
 Planning
 Organizing
 Critical Thinking
 Problem Solving
